text:
I think I may be going crazy, but did I break something…
```using DifferentialEquations,Plots

f(du,u,p,t) = u


# Put in some random parameters
tfinal = 10.0
n0 = 10
N = 100
u0 = n0/N

tspan = (0.0,tfinal)
prob = ODEProblem(f,u0,tspan)
sol = solve(prob,Tsit5(),reltol=1e-5, abstol=1e-8)```
Gives an error:
```ERROR: LoadError: MethodError: no method matching similar(::Float64, ::Type{Float64})```
I tried defining `f` as a function as well
```function f(du,u,p,t)

	du = u

end```
Which also had the same error… am I doing something stupid? Or do I need to reload the package?

elements.text: I think I may be going crazy, but did I break something…

f(du,u,p,t) = u


# Put in some random parameters
tfinal = 10.0
n0 = 10
N = 100
u0 = n0/N

tspan = (0.0,tfinal)
prob = ODEProblem(f,u0,tspan)
sol = solve(prob,Tsit5(),reltol=1e-5, abstol=1e-8)
ERROR: LoadError: MethodError: no method matching similar(::Float64, ::Type{Float64})
Which also had the same error… am I doing something stupid? Or do I need to reload the package?

text: You either have to define your function as `f(u,p,t) = u` or use an array for `u0`

elements.text: You either have to define your function as

text: In-place systems don't work with scalars
